articles.title: Fighting an infodemic: Covid-19 fake news dataset
articles.authors: P Patwa, S Sharma, S Pykl, V Guptha, G Kumari, MS Akhtar, A Ekbal, ...
articles.publication: International Workshop on​ Combating On​ line Ho​ st​ ile Posts in​ Regional …, 2021

bib.title: Fighting an infodemic: Covid-19 fake news dataset
author: P Patwa
S Sharma
S Pykl
V Guptha
G Kumari
bib.venue: … line Ho​ st​ ile Posts in …
bib.abstract: Along with COVID-19 pandemic we are also fighting an 'infodemic'. Fake news and rumors are rampant on social media. Believing in rumors can cause significant harm. This is further exacerbated at the time of a pandemic. To tackle this, we curate and release a manually annotated dataset of 10,700 social media posts and articles of real and fake news on COVID-19. We perform a binary classification task (real vs fake) and benchmark the annotated dataset with four machine learning baselines-Decision Tree, Logistic Regression, Gradient

articles.title: A database of infant cry sounds to study the likely cause of cry
articles.authors: S Sharma, S Asthana, VK Mittal
articles.publication: Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Natural Language …, 2015

bib.title: A database of infant cry sounds to study the likely cause of cry
author: S Sharma
S Asthana
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Infant cry is a mode of communication, for interacting and drawing attention. The infants cry due to physiological, emotional or some ailment reasons. Cry involves high pitch changes in the signal. In this paper we describe an 'Infant Cry Sounds Database'(ICSD), collected especially for the study of likely cause of an infant's cry. The database consists of infant cry sounds due to six causes: pain, discomfort, emotional need, ailment, environmental factors and hunger/thirst. The ground truth cause of cry is established with the help of two medical

articles.title: Window selection for accurate music source separation using REPET
articles.publication: 2016 3rd International Conference on Signal Processing and Integrated …, 2016

bib.title: Window selection for accurate music source separation using REPET
author: S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Separating music into vocal and non-vocal (back ground music) components is a challenging task, though it has a wide range of applications. The repeating rhythmic and beat property of the music, along with other accompaniments, has been leveraged in theRepeated pattern extraction technique'(REPET), for separating a song into its vocal and non-vocal content. The REPET method involves measuring the repeating period of the music, deriving a model using it, and creating a time-frequency mask for separating the

articles.title: A low cost intelligent smart system for real time infant monitoring and cry detection
articles.authors: PR Myakala, R Nalumachu, S Sharma, VK Mittal

bib.title: A low cost intelligent smart system for real time infant monitoring and cry detection
author: PR Myakala
R Nalumachu
S Sharma
bib.abstract: Acoustic analysis of cry signals helps understanding the physiological and emotional state of an infant, and the likely cause of cry. In our earlier studies, acoustic analysis was carried out to characterize the infant cry signal due to different cause of crying. In this paper, we propose an Intelligent Cry Monitoring and Cry Detection System (ICMCDS) that can help working parents who are constrained to leave their children with the care-takers, and remain worried about their well-being. They need to be notified when their child cries. Functional

articles.title: MOMENTA: A Multimodal Framework for Detecting Harmful Memes and Their Targets
articles.authors: S Pramanick, S Sharma, D Dimitrov, MS Akhtar, P Nakov, T Chakraborty

bib.title: MOMENTA: A Multimodal Framework for Detecting Harmful Memes and Their Targets
author: S Pramanick
S Sharma
D Dimitrov
MS Akhtar
bib.abstract: Internet memes have become powerful means to transmit political, psychological, and socio-cultural ideas. Although memes are typically humorous, recent days have witnessed an escalation of harmful memes used for trolling, cyberbullying, and abuse. Detecting such memes is challenging as they can be highly satirical and cryptic. Moreover, while previous work has focused on specific aspects of memes such as hate speech and propaganda, there has been little work on harm in general. Here, we aim to bridge this gap. We focus on two

articles.title: Infant cry analysis of cry signal segments towards identifying the cry-cause factors

bib.title: Infant cry analysis of cry signal segments towards identifying the cry-cause factors
author: S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Infants communicate their physiological state and emotions mostly by crying. Identifying the cause of crying is natural and easy for human beings, but challenging for machines. Automatic identification of cry-cause factors has vast applications in assistive healthcare and timely remedial measures in critical situations. In this paper, Infant cry signals analysis is carried out to identify four cry-causes, namely, Environmental Change, Discomfort, Stranger's Anxiety and Pain. Different causes of infant crying are characterized by examining

articles.title: A qualitative assessment of different sound types of an infant cry
articles.publication: 2017 4th IEEE Uttar Pradesh section international conference on electrical …, 2017

bib.title: A qualitative assessment of different sound types of an infant cry
author: S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Acoustic characteristics of the cry sound can indicate cry-cause, as it can be perceived easily by humans. Features melody contour, MFCCs and harmonics factors have been explored to identify different sound types of infants cries. But detection of cry-causes is lesser explored. In this paper, different types of infant cries are analyzed from the spectral patterns derived from acoustic signals. Different cry-sound patterns are identified related to different cause-factors of infant cries. A Infant Cry Sounds Database (IIITS-ICSD 2), consisting of

articles.title: Singing characterization using temporal and spectral features in indian musical notes
articles.publication: 2016 International Conference on Signal Processing and Communication (ICSC …, 2016

bib.title: Singing characterization using temporal and spectral features in indian musical notes
author: S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Pitch extraction from a multi pitched music signal significantly relies on the training data for tasks like enhanced music-voice separation. This paper aims at identifying characteristic temporal and spectral features, using speech processing techniques that can help obtain crucial information, leading to a better understanding of the music structure. Towards this goal, the F 0 contour has been studied to capture the melodic trends in a Sargam progression, and the results have been compared with the output of state of the art package

articles.title: An intelligent system for infant cry detection and information in real time
articles.authors: PR Myakala, R Nalumachu, S Sharma, VK Mittal
articles.publication: 2017 Seventh International Conference on Affective Computing and Intelligent …, 2017

bib.title: An intelligent system for infant cry detection and information in real time
author: PR Myakala
R Nalumachu
S Sharma
bib.abstract: Acoustic analysis of infant cry signal can indicate the physical-emotional state of a baby and the cry-cause. Knowing it remotely is a challenge for working parents. This paper proposes anIntelligent Cry Detection Information System (ICDIS)', to automatically detect an infant's cry and alert the parents. Parents can verify whether baby is in-fact crying, by informing a care taker who can send a web/app-controlled smart robot to fetch live video-streaming. It also sends text/image message to the parent, with urgency-level. The proposed system consists

articles.title: Acoustic analysis of infant cry signal towards automatic detection of the cause of crying
articles.authors: S Sharma, PR Myakala, R Nalumachu, SV Gangashetty, VK Mittal
articles.publication: 2017 Seventh International Conference on Affective Computing and Intelligent …, 2017

bib.title: Acoustic analysis of infant cry signal towards automatic detection of the cause of crying
author: S Sharma
PR Myakala
R Nalumachu
bib.abstract: Infant cry signal carries enough clues about the cry cause. Using these clues, a mother or a paediatrician can easily identify the probable cry-cause, and emotional or physiological state of the baby. In our earlier studies, differences between infant cries due to pain and discomfort were examined using features derived from the cry signal. In this paper, acoustic analysis of the infant cry signal is carried out for 4 cry-causes: discomfort, environmental factors, pain and strangers anxiety. Acoustic features are derived from the infant cry signal

articles.title: Acoustic analysis of Indian classical music using signal processing methods
articles.authors: S Ghisingh, S Sharma, VK Mittal

bib.title: Acoustic analysis of Indian classical music using signal processing methods
author: S Ghisingh
S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Identification of music components and further acoustic analysis of Indian classical music are challenging issues, due to large variations in these. This papers consists of two major studies, singing-voice analysis and music-source separation. Indian ragas are divided into lyrical composition and alaap regions, ie, regions of improvisation that indicate versatility of the singer. Acoustic analyses of both male and female singing voice is carried out by examining the production characteristics. The source feature F 0 is obtained using two

articles.title: Wireless audio communication over Infra-Red medium
articles.authors: A Korian, S Sharma, VK Mittal
articles.publication: 2016 3rd International Conference on Signal Processing and Integrated …, 2016

bib.title: Wireless audio communication over Infra-Red medium
author: A Korian
S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: In the modern era, a number of devices are going to dominate every sources of human in their day to day daily lives. These devices may be connected and/or controlled through Web, infra-Red (IR) and other means. Hence, exploring alternative means of communication is not only important but may also help towards mitigating the risk of security breach in communication channels. In this paper, we explore the possibility of communicating speech and music, over IR channel. Audio communication using an IR transmitter source and

articles.title: Infant Crying Cause Recognition using Conventional and Deep Learning based Approaches
articles.authors: S Sharma, P Viswanath, V Kumar

bib.title: Infant Crying Cause Recognition using Conventional and Deep Learning based Approaches
author: S Sharma
P Viswanath
V Kumar
bib.abstract: Significant information about psychophysiological state of an infant is embedded in the cry signal. Few studies are carried out for identifying and analyzing this information. But the infant cry-cause recognition task using computational classification models is not attempted yet. In our earlier works, the characterization of infant cry signals for different cry-causes were studied. In this study, we aim to recognize different crycauses using machine-learning based classifiers. A dataset (ICSD2) was especially collected for this study. Acoustic features

articles.title: Component Characterization of Western and Indian Classical Music
articles.authors: S Sharma, S Ghisingh, VK Mittal
articles.publication: International Symposium on Signal Processing and Intelligent Recognition …, 2017

bib.title: Component Characterization of Western and Indian Classical Music
author: S Sharma
S Ghisingh
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Regular pitch detection algorithms are known to be immensely useful for speech source analysis. Their utility is not as reliable when processing polyphonic acoustic mixtures like Music. This is an investigative study of music components like rhythm, accompaniment and Lyrical-voicing, that is seen as a critical task towards targeted music component identification and processing. Popular music forms like Western and Hindustani Classical are considered for our study dataset. For Western cases, comparative preliminary analysis of

articles.title: Study of Indian classical music by singing voice analysis and music source separation
articles.authors: S Ghisingh, S Sharma, VK Mittal
articles.publication: 2017 2nd International Conference on Telecommunication and Networks (TEL-NET …, 2017

bib.title: Study of Indian classical music by singing voice analysis and music source separation
author: S Ghisingh
S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: The pitch variations in classical singing are known for their pleasant appeal. But these also add to the challenges in acoustic analysis of singing voice signals. The characteristics of singing voice signal such as variable base frequency, inter-tonal gaps, and intense and rapid changes within each pitch-period need to be examined, along with changes in the background music signal. In this paper, we first separate and then characterize the singing voice and music signal, by analyzing the changes in production features. The pitch, formants

articles.title: Separating the source information in repetition-dependent music and enhancing it by real-time digital audio processing
articles.authors: S Sharma, K Kumar, VK Mittal
articles.publication: 2017 2nd International Conference on Telecommunication and Networks (TEL-NET …, 2017

bib.title: Separating the source information in repetition-dependent music and enhancing it by real-time digital audio processing
author: S Sharma
K Kumar
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: The repetitive patterns and rhythmic components in the music signal give enough clues about its structure. Using this insight, a repetition-based source separation technique was examined in our earlier work. A set of windowing techniques were examined to optimally separate an acoustic mixture of foreground vocal signal and the repetitive background musical accompaniments, into respective constituents. In this paper, we compare two approaches and their results, for achieving the music-source separation. First, a software

articles.title: Music component characterization in the music-speech mixture for female singing tracks
articles.publication: 2017 2nd International Conference on Telecommunication and Networks (TEL-NET …, 2017

bib.title: Music component characterization in the music-speech mixture for female singing tracks
author: S Sharma
VK Mittal
bib.abstract: Conventional pitch-contour extraction techniques often exploit the quasi-periodic nature of speech signals. However, the task of pitch extraction for singing voice signal is challenging, especially when the music signals are mixed with multi-pitch speech sound signals. Usually, the background music signal is characterized by rhythmic and repetitive patterns in the music-speech mixture. Hence, in this paper we propose a pitch extraction method for such a music-speech mixture, by exploiting these characteristics. The signal processing techniques
